channel.title: Talks on GGVY
channel.description: Recent content in Talks on GGVY

item.title: Big Problems for Small Networks: Statistical Analysis of Small Networks and Team Performance
item.description: As an invitation from Prof. Noshir Contractor, I gave this talk at Northwestern University’s SONIC Lab followed by a workshop on the tools that we have been developing for implemting the methods described in it. The lab was kind enough to record my talk as well as advertise it here This is joint work with Prof. Kayla de la Haye (USC).

item.title: Small network statistics for the network science of teams
item.description: Joint work with Kayla de la Haye.

item.title: Redes y Econometria Espacial con R
item.description: This was my first time talking about Statistical models for network analysis and spatial econometrics in my native language (spanish). This very same workshop was taught during December 2018 and January 2019 at: Instituto Milenio Fundamento de los datos, Universidad Católica de Chile. Centro de Investigación en Complejidad Social (CISC), Universidad del Desarrollo. Another version of my talk can be found here.

item.title: Computacion de Alto Rendimiento con R
item.description: This was my first time talking about HPC with R in my native language (spanish). This very same workshop was taught during December 2018 and January 2019 at: The SatRdays conference in Santiago de Chile (organized by my friends at the R Users Group in SCL and R Ladies in SCL). Instituto Milenio para el Fundamento de los Datos at Universidad Católica de Chile (website). Núcleo Milenio para el estudio del curso de vida y vulnerabilidad at Universidad de Santiago de Chile (folks there were very nice and wrote two news articles based on my talk: one and two).

item.title: Big Problems for Small Networks: Small Network Statistics
item.description: Joint work with Kayla de la Haye.

item.title: R Bootcamp for Scientific Computing
item.description: This 5-day bootcamp was held at USC’s Department of Preventive medicine jointly with Malcolm Barrett.

item.title: Workshop: Introduction to R (for HPC users)
item.description: The presentation source code can be found here

item.title: The 'Happy Scientist' Workshop #1: An introduction to high-performance computing using R
item.description: This talk was jointly with Garrett Weaver. The presentation source code can be found here

item.title: Uncomplicated Parallel Computing with Stata
item.description: This talk was done by my coauthor Brian Quistorff.

item.title: A brief introduction to using R for high-performance computing
item.description: This talk was jointly with Garrett Weaver. The presentation source code can be found here

item.title: Matching in the Context of Network Data: Statistical inference without SIENA and ERGMS
Network Diffusion of Innovations in R: Introducing netdiffuseR
Tutorial Rcpp: Cómo usar C++ en R con sólo 3 líneas!
item.description: Tutorial de Rcpp en español. Grupo de Usuarios de R en Chile.
